thread.title: At least 1 dead in small plane crash near site of wildfire in Oroville, Wash - @DerekKXLY
thread.title_full: At least 1 dead in small plane crash near site of wildfire in Oroville, Wash - @DerekKXLY

author: Shelley Ng
title: At least 1 dead in small plane crash near site of wildfire in Oroville, Wash - @DerekKXLY
text:
Courtesy: Okanogan Valley Gazette-Tribune OROVILLE, Wash. - 
While assisting area fire crews responding to several fires in the Oroville area, deputies found the wreckage of an aircraft with at least one person dead at the scene. 
Okanogan County Sheriff Frank Rogers confirmed the aircraft was found by deputies on Rise Road off Chesaw Road. There's no information on what type of aircraft it was and there has been no confirmation from other agencies, including the Department of Natural Resources, as to whether or not they have lost contact with one of their aircraft. 
Those fire crews in the Oroville area are responding to a new fire, called the 9 Mile Fire by DNR, which has burned 100 acres so far off Chesaw Road. 
DNR confirms that structures are threatened at the fire and a Type 3 Incident Management Team has been requested to fight the fire.
